home-loan.name: Home Loan
home-loan.overview: Apne ghar ka sapna saakar karein. We offer a wide range of home loan products designed to meet your unique needs, whether you are buying, constructing, or renovating your home. With competitive interest rates and long tenure, we make home ownership affordable and easy.

purchase.name: New Home Purchase
purchase.eligibility: Applicant must be an Indian resident, aged between 21 to 65 years. Salaried individuals or self-employed professionals with a stable income source and a good credit score (700+) are eligible.
features: Flexible repayment tenure up to 30 years
Loan amounts up to 90% of property value
documents: Form 16 or ITR for last 2 years
Allotment letter or Sale agreement of the property

faq.q: Can I get 100% financing for my home?
faq.a: Most banks finance up to 80-90% of the property value. The rest needs to be contributed by the buyer as a down payment.

faq.q: Can a co-applicant be added to the home loan?
faq.a: Yes, you can add a co-applicant, like your spouse or immediate family member, which can also help in increasing your loan eligibility.

construction.name: Home Construction
construction.eligibility: You must own a plot of land with clear titles. A detailed construction estimate, approved by a certified architect, and necessary permissions from local authorities are required.
features: Finance for construction on a freehold or leasehold plot
Loan disbursed in tranches based on construction stage
documents: Approved building plans from local authorities
Construction cost estimate from an architect

faq.q: How is the loan disbursed for construction?
faq.a: The loan is typically disbursed in 4-5 installments based on the progress of construction, which is verified by the bank.

renovation.name: Home Renovation
renovation.eligibility: Must be the owner of the property being renovated. A detailed estimate of the renovation work from a contractor or architect is needed.
features: Covers costs of tiling, flooring, painting, plumbing, etc.
No collateral required for smaller amounts

faq.q: Is there a limit on the renovation loan amount?
faq.a: Yes, the loan amount depends on your income eligibility and the renovation estimate, subject to the bank's policy.

business-loan.name: Business Loan
business-loan.overview: Apne business ko nayi unchaiyon tak pahunchayein. Our business loans are designed to provide the financial support you need for expansion, purchasing machinery, or managing working capital. We offer both secured and unsecured options to fit your business needs.

working-capital.name: Working Capital Loan
working-capital.eligibility: For businesses operational for at least 3 years with stable sales and profit. Required documents include GST returns and audited financials.
documents: GST returns for the last year
Bank statements for the last 12 months

faq.q: What is the difference between a cash credit and an overdraft facility?
faq.a: Both are working capital loans. A cash credit is a short-term loan against inventory and receivables, while an overdraft allows you to withdraw more than your account balance up to a sanctioned limit.

term.name: Term Loan
term.eligibility: For established businesses looking for funds for capital expenditure like machinery purchase or expansion. A strong business plan and profitability track record are essential.
documents: Detailed project report for the proposed expenditure

faq.q: Can a term loan be prepaid?
faq.a: Yes, most banks allow prepayment of term loans, though some may charge a prepayment penalty. It is advisable to check the terms before applying.

msme.name: MSME Loan
msme.eligibility: The business must be registered as a Micro, Small, or Medium Enterprise (MSME) under the Udyam portal. Eligibility often aligns with various government schemes.
features: Lower interest rates under government schemes

faq.q: Is collateral always required for an MSME loan?
faq.a: Not necessarily. Under the CGTMSE scheme, you can get collateral-free loans up to ₹5 crore from eligible banks.

personal-loan.name: Personal Loan
personal-loan.overview: Har zaroorat ke liye, turant financial solution. Personal loans are the perfect solution for your immediate financial needs, be it a wedding, vacation, or medical emergency. With minimal documentation and quick disbursal, get the funds you need without any hassle.

wedding.name: Wedding Loan
wedding.eligibility: Available for both salaried and self-employed individuals with a strong credit history and a minimum monthly income of ₹25,000.

faq.q: How much loan can I get for a wedding?
faq.a: The loan amount depends on your income, credit score, and repayment capacity. It can range from ₹50,000 to ₹40 Lakhs.

travel.name: Travel Loan
travel.eligibility: Indian residents with a stable job and a good credit score can apply. Some lenders might ask for travel bookings.
features: No need to dip into your savings
documents: Optionally, travel tickets or hotel bookings

faq.q: Is a travel loan better than using a credit card?
faq.a: Travel loans often come with lower interest rates than credit cards, making them a more cost-effective option for planned vacations.

medical.name: Medical Emergency Loan
medical.eligibility: Available to salaried and self-employed individuals. The process is expedited for emergencies, requiring basic KYC and income documents.
features: Covers hospitalization, surgery, and other medical bills
documents: Hospital admission papers or estimate (if available)

faq.q: Can I get a loan if I don't have health insurance?
faq.a: Absolutely. A medical loan is designed to help you cover expenses irrespective of whether you have health insurance or not.

vehicle-loan.name: Vehicle Loan
vehicle-loan.overview: Apni pasand ki gaadi ghar laayein. Our vehicle loans make it easy to buy your dream vehicle with attractive interest rates, flexible tenures, and high loan-to-value ratios for new, pre-owned, and commercial vehicles.

new-car.name: New Car Loan
new-car.eligibility: Applicant must be at least 21 years old and have a stable income source. Loan approval depends on the car model and your credit profile.
features: Funding up to 100% of the on-road price
Flexible repayment tenure up to 7 years
documents: Pro-forma invoice from the car dealer
Valid KYC documents (Aadhaar, PAN, Passport, etc.)

faq.q: What does "on-road price" include?
faq.a: The on-road price includes the ex-showroom price, RTO registration charges, road tax, and insurance.

used-car.name: Used Car & Vehicle Loan
used-car.eligibility: The car should not be more than 5-7 years old. A valuation report of the car from a certified professional is mandatory.
features: Get up to 90% of the car's valuation as a loan
Helps in buying a better car within your budget
Thorough check on car documents by the bank

faq.q: Is the interest rate for used car loans higher?
faq.a: Yes, interest rates for used car loans are generally slightly higher than new car loans due to the higher perceived risk.

commercial-vehicle.name: Commercial Vehicle Loan
commercial-vehicle.eligibility: For individuals or businesses purchasing vehicles for commercial use like trucks, buses, or taxis. A valid commercial driving license and vehicle permit are required.
features: Funding for a wide range of commercial vehicles

faq.q: Can I get a loan for a second-hand truck?
faq.a: Yes, we provide financing for both new and used commercial vehicles, subject to the vehicle's age and condition.

lap-loan.name: Loan Against Property
lap-loan.overview: Unlock the value of your property. A Loan Against Property (LAP) is a secured loan that you can avail by mortgaging your residential or commercial property. This is a great way to get a large loan amount at a lower interest rate for various purposes like business expansion, education, or weddings.

msme-lap.name: LAP for MSME
msme-lap.eligibility: For businesses registered as MSME who own a commercial or residential property. This loan is ideal for business expansion, working capital, or other business-related expenses.
features: Higher loan amount for business needs
Longer repayment tenure up to 15 years
Funds can be used for any business purpose

faq.q: Can I get a LAP for my new MSME business?
faq.a: Most lenders require a business to be operational for a few years. However, policies vary, and we can help you find a suitable lender based on your profile and property value.

lap-loan.eligibility: Owner of the property (residential or commercial). The property must have a clear title and be free from any legal disputes. Your income and repayment capacity will also be assessed.
features: High loan amount based on property value
Lower interest rates compared to unsecured loans
Can be used for any personal or business purpose

faq.q: Can I continue to use my property during the loan tenure?
faq.a: Yes, you retain the ownership and can continue using your property as usual. Only the original documents are kept with the bank as security.

faq.q: What percentage of my property value can I get as a loan?
faq.a: You can typically get a loan amount of up to 60-70% of the market value of your property.

health-insurance.name: Health Insurance
health-insurance.overview: Protect your health and finances. Health insurance provides a financial safety net against high medical expenses, ensuring you and your family receive the best possible care without financial worries.

individual.name: Individual Health Cover
individual.eligibility: Any individual between 18 to 65 years of age can purchase this policy.

faq.q: What is a waiting period in health insurance?
faq.a: A waiting period is the duration you must wait before you can claim some or all benefits of your health insurance policy. This is common for pre-existing conditions.

family.name: Family Floater Plan
family.eligibility: Covers the entire family under a single policy, including self, spouse, children, and sometimes parents.
features: Single premium for the whole family
Sum insured floats among all family members
documents: KYC documents of the primary insured person
Details of all family members to be covered

faq.q: Can I add my parents to my family floater plan?
faq.a: Some policies allow adding parents, but it's often recommended to get a separate senior citizen policy for them due to their higher health risks.

life-insurance.name: Life Insurance
life-insurance.overview: Secure your family's future. Life insurance provides a lump-sum amount to your family in your absence, ensuring they can maintain their lifestyle and achieve their financial goals without any burden.

term.name: Term Plan
term.eligibility: Available for individuals from 18 to 65 years. Provides high coverage at a low premium for a fixed term.
features: High sum assured at affordable premiums
Rider options for critical illness & accidental death

faq.q: What happens if I survive the policy term?
faq.a: In a pure term plan, no maturity benefit is paid if you survive the policy term. However, some plans now offer a 'Return of Premium' option at a higher cost.

endowment.name: Endowment Plan
endowment.eligibility: Combines insurance with savings. Suitable for long-term goal planning.
features: Dual benefit of insurance and savings

faq.q: Is an endowment plan a good investment?
faq.a: Endowment plans offer safe, guaranteed returns but are generally lower than market-linked products. They are good for risk-averse individuals.

vehicle-insurance.name: Vehicle Insurance
vehicle-insurance.overview: Drive with confidence. Vehicle insurance protects you against financial losses from accidents, theft, or damage to your vehicle, and also covers third-party liabilities as mandated by law.

car.name: Car Insurance
car.eligibility: Mandatory for all car owners in India.
features: Covers damage to your own car (OD)
Add-ons like zero depreciation & roadside assistance

faq.q: What is the difference between third-party and comprehensive insurance?
faq.a: Third-party insurance is mandatory and only covers damages to another person or property. Comprehensive insurance covers third-party liability plus damage or theft of your own vehicle.

faq.q: Is personal accident cover included by default?
faq.a: Yes, a personal accident cover of ₹15 lakhs for the owner-driver is mandatory with bike insurance.

commercial.name: Commercial Vehicle Insurance
commercial.eligibility: Required for all vehicles used for commercial purposes, such as trucks, buses, and taxis.

faq.q: Does it cover the goods being transported?
faq.a: No, standard commercial vehicle insurance does not cover the goods. For that, you would need a separate Marine or Goods in Transit insurance policy.

general-insurance.name: General Insurance
general-insurance.overview: Protect your valuable assets. General insurance provides coverage for a wide range of non-life assets, including your shop, property, and even your travels, safeguarding you from unexpected financial losses.

shop.name: Shopkeeper Insurance
shop.eligibility: For owners of small to medium-sized shops.
features: Protection against fire, theft, and natural calamities
documents: List of contents to be insured

faq.q: Does it cover loss of money in the shop?
faq.a: Yes, many shopkeeper policies offer an add-on or built-in cover for loss of money in transit or from a safe.

property.name: Property Insurance
property.eligibility: For owners of residential or commercial properties.
features: Protection for building structure and contents
Option to include rent loss cover

faq.q: Is property insurance the same as home insurance?
faq.a: Home insurance is a type of property insurance specifically for residential homes. Property insurance is a broader term that can also cover commercial buildings.

fire.name: Fire Insurance
fire.eligibility: For any individual or business that wants to protect their property against fire damage.
features: Covers damages due to fire, lightning, and explosions
Can be extended to cover riots, storms, and floods
Essential for businesses with high-value stock
documents: List of assets to be insured

faq.q: What is not covered in a standard fire policy?
faq.a: Standard policies usually exclude damages from war, nuclear perils, and willful destruction of property.

travel.name: Travel Insurance
travel.eligibility: For individuals and families travelling domestically or internationally.
features: Protection against trip cancellation or delay

faq.q: Do I need travel insurance for domestic trips?
faq.a: While not mandatory, it is highly recommended as it can cover flight cancellations, baggage loss, and medical emergencies even within the country.
